atu.help: atu help [subcmd]: Display atu command options

addEntry.help: atu addEntry [options] : Creates the new entry in MAC address table

[options](default value for option item: options for atu entry, format as: -macAddr aabbccddee00 -state 7
[options](default value for option item.-lag: trunk member or LAG, bool type: 0 or 1

getNext.help: atu getNext <macAddr> <fid>: Get next atu entry

paraList.macAddr: mac address strart to search, format as aabbccddee00

delAll.help: atu delAll <deleteCMD> : Delete all or all non-static atu entry

delAllInDB.help: atu delAllInDB <deleteCMD> <fid>: Delete all atu entry based on the DB number

move.help: atu move <moveCMD> <moveFrom> <moveTo>: Move all or all non-static atu entry

moveInDB.help: atu moveInDB <moveCMD> <fid> <moveFrom> <moveTo>: Move the atu entry based on fid

delEntry.help: atu delEntry <macAddr> <fid> : Delete the specified atu entry

getVio.help: atu getVio : Get the atu Violation data

setAging.help: atu setAging <timeout> : Set the atu entry aging time out in millisecond

getAging.help: atu getAging : Get the atu entry aging time out in millisecond

portRemove.help: atu portRemove <RemoveCMD> <port> : Remove all or all non-static addresses from a port

portRemoveInDB.help: atu portRemoveInDB <RemoveCMD> <fid> <port> : Remove all or all non-static addresses from a port in the specified ATU fid

getLearn2All.help: atu getLearn2All : Get the learn on all devices status

setLearn2All.help: atu setLearn2All <en> : Set the learn on all devices

setPortLearnLimit.help: atu setPortLearnLimit <port> <limit> : Set auto learning limit for specified port of a specified device

getPortLearnLimit.help: atu getPortLearnLimit <port> : Get auto learning limit for specified port of a specified device

getLearnCount.help: atu getLearnCount <port>: Read the current number of active unicast MAC addresses associated with the given port

getCount.help: atu getCount : Counts all entries in the Address Translation Unit

getCountPerFid.help: atu getCountPerFid <fid> : Counts all non-static entries in the specified fid in the Address Translation Unit

getNonStaticCount.help: atu getNonStaticCount : Counts all non-static entries in the Address Translation Unit

getNonStaticCountPerFid.help: atu getNonStaticCountPerFid <fid> : Counts all non-static entries in the specified fid in the Address Translation Unit

dump.help: atu dump <fid> : Find all MAC address in the specified fid and print them out

stu.help: stu help [subcmd]: Display stu command options

[options](default value for option item: options for stu entry, format as: -sid 1 -portState {1 2 3}

-portState: array of Per VLAN Port States for each port
-portState {1 2 3} means port0 is blocking, port1 is learning
port2 is forwarding, and all other ports are disable

getNext.help: stu getNext <sid> : Get next valid stu entry

paraList.sid: 802.1s Port State Information Database (SID) number, valid value is 0 ~ 63

findEntry.help: stu findEntry <sid> : Find stu entry with input sid

paraList.sid: 802.1s Port State Information Database (SID) number, valid value is 0 ~ 63

delEntry.help: stu delEntry <sid>: Delete the specified stu entry

paraList.sid: 802.1s Port State Information Database (SID) number, valid value is 0 ~ 63

getCount.help: stu getCount : Get number of valid entries in the STU table

dump.help: stu dump : Find all the stu entries and print them out

ecid.help: ecid help [subcmd]: Display ecid command oprions

setBpeEnable.help: ecid setBpeEnable <en> : Enable or disable the port extender feature

paraList.en: 1 enable the port extender feature, 0 otherwise

getBpeEnable.help: ecid getBpeEnable : Get the port extender feature enable status

addEntry.help: ecid addEntry [options] : Creates the new ecid entry in ECID table

[options](default value for option item: options for ecid entry, format as: -group 0 -ecid 1 -state 1
[options](default value for option item.-lag: MSD_TRUE if entry belongs to a LAG
[options](default value for option item.-lagId: LAG ID if lag is MSD_TRUE

delAll.help: ecid delAll : Delete all the ecid entries

move.help: ecid move <moveForm> <moveTo> : Move the ecid entry form moveFrom to moveTo

delEntry.help: ecid delEntry <group> <ecid> : Delete one specified ecid entry

getNext.help: ecid getNext <group> <ecid> : Get next valid ecid entry

findEntry.help: ecid findEntry <group> <ecid> : Find the specified ecid entry

getCount.help: ecid getCount : Count all the ecid entries

dump.help: ecid dump : Find all the ecid entries and print them out

vlan.help: vlan help [subcmd]: Display vtu command options

[options](default value for option item: options for vtu entry, format as: -vid 1 -sid 1
[options](default value for option item.-fid: database number or FID (forwarding information database)

-TagP: -TagP {1 2 3} means port0 is MEMBER_EGRESS_UNTAGGED, port1 is MEMBER_EGRESS_TAGGED
port2 is NOT_A_MEMBER, and all other ports are MEMBER_EGRESS_UNMODIFIED

[options](default value for option item.-vidPolicy: indicate that the frame with this VID uses VID Policy

delAll.help: vlan delAll : Flush all vlan entry

isExist.help: vlan isExist <vlanId> : Check if the vlan entry exist

getNext.help: vlan getNext <vlanId> : Get next vlan entry

paraList.vlanId: vlan entry id (this parameter is optional)

delEntry.help: vlan delEntry <vlanId>: Delete the specified vlan entry

setMode.help: vlan setMode <modeValue>: Set the vlan mode

<modeValue>: 0 : 4K vtu, vtu page should be 0 unless overridden by TCAM
1 : 8K vtu with vtu page being 0 if a frame is a unicast frame

2 : use 8K vtu with vtu page being = to the source 
	port VTU page bit(port offset 0x05)

3 : use 8K vtu with vtu page being a one if frame is not properly 
	Provider tagged entering a Provider port

getMode.help: vlan getMode : Get the vlan mode

getVio.help: vlan getVio : Get the vlan Violation data

getCount.help: vlan getCount : Get the valid entry count in the VTU table

setMemberTag.help: vlan setMemberTag <vlanId> <portNum> <memberTag> : Update the vlan entry member tag

getMemberTag.help: vlan getMemberTag <vlanId> <portNum> : Get the memberTag for special port if it exist

dump.help: vlan dump : Find all the vlan entries and print them out

interrupt.help: interrupt help [subcmd]: Display interrupt command options

setDevIntEnable.help: interrupt setDevIntEnable <data>: Enables or disables interrupt Mask to drive the DeviceInt bit.

en: the data of interrupt to enable/disable. any combination of below

getDevIntEnable.help: interrupt getDevIntEnable: gets interrupt Mask enable or disable drive the DeviceInt bit.

setActiveIntEnable.help: interrupt setActiveIntEnable <data>: Enables or disables interrupt to drive the device's INTn pin low.

en: the data of interrupt to enable/disable. any combination of below

getActiveIntEnable.help: interrupt getActiveIntEnable: gets interrupt enable or disable to drive the device's INTn pin low.

getActiveIntStatus.help: interrupt getActiveIntStatus: reads an hardware driven event status

serdes.help: serdes help [subcmd] : Display serdes command options

paraList.portNum: logical port number, valid ports are 9, 10, 11

xrr.help: serdes xrr <devAddr> <phyAddr> <regAddr> : Indirectly read internal Serdes register through SMI C45 command

xrw.help: serdes xrw <devAddr> <phyAddr> <regAddr> <data> : Indirectly write internal Serdes register through SMI C45 command

irl.help: irl help [subcmd]: Display ingress rate limiter command options

reset.help: irl reset : Initializes all PIRL Resources for all ports

initResCount.help: irl initResCount <port> <res>: Initializes the selected PIRL Resource counter per port

paraList.tgtRate: target rate (units is kfps when countMode = MSD_PIRL_COUNT_FRAME, otherwise units is kbps)

readRes.help: irl readRes <port> <res> : Read Resource bucket parameter

writeRes.help: irl writeRes <port> <res> [options]: Writes Resource bucket parameter

[options](default value for option item: options to set IRL data
[options](default value for option item.-bktTypeMask: various traffic type to be counted
[options](default value for option item.-tcamFlows: indicate to account for tcam flows 0 to 3, but not TCP/UDP data

-useFPri: determine what priority type this resource is to account
0 : use the QPri assigned to the frame
1 : use the FPri assigned to the frame

[options](default value for option item.-priSelect: priority bit mask that each bit indicates one of the eight priorities
[options](default value for option item.-colorAware: set to color aware mode or color blind mode
[options](default value for option item.-accountGrnOverflow: Green&Yellow buckets are connected when in Coloar Aware mode
[options](default value for option item.-accountQConf: account discarded frames due to queue congestion
[options](default value for option item.-accountFiltered: account filtered frames. Account for All
[options](default value for option item.-samplingMode: sample one out of so many frames/bytes for a stream of frames

-actionMode: action should be taken when there are not enough tokens to accept the entire incoming frame

[options](default value for option item.-fcPriority: used when port PFC mode enabled
[options](default value for option item.-ebsLimit: Excess Burst Size limit on the Yellow bucket ( 0 ~ 0xFFFFFF)
[options](default value for option item.-cbsLimit: Committed Burst Size limit on the Green bucket
[options](default value for option item.-bktIncrement: the amount of tokens that need to be added for each byte of packet information
[options](default value for option item.-bktRateFactorGrn: the amount of tokens that need to be decremented for each rate
[options](default value for option item.-bktRateFactorYel: the amount of tokens that need to be decremented for each rate
[options](default value for option item.-countMode: Frame bytes or Frames to be accounted for in the rate resource's rate limiting calculations

rr.help: irl rr <port> <res> <offset>: Read general IRL register value

rw.help: irl rw <port> <res> <offset> <data>: Write general IRL register value

advConfig.help: irl advConfig <port> <res> <tgtRate> <tgtBstSize> <countMode> [options] : Config ingress rate limit based on packet type or priority the given resource of the port

paraList.tgtRate: target rate (units is kfps when countMode = MSD_PIRL_COUNT_FRAME, otherwise units is kbps)

[options](default value for option item: options to set packet type or priority
[options](default value for option item.-bktTypeMask: various traffic type to be counted
[options](default value for option item.-tcamFlows: indicate to account for tcam flows 0 to 3, but not TCP/UDP data
[options](default value for option item.-useFPri: used to determine what priority type this resource is to account
[options](default value for option item.-priSelect: priority bit mask that each bit indicates one of the eight priorities

disableAdvConfig.help: irl disableAdvConfig <port> <res> : Clear config for ingress rate limit to the given resource of the port

setXRate.help: qav setXRate <port> <queue> <rate> : Set priority queue rate on a port

paraList.rate: rate in kbps and increments of 32kbps

getXRate.help: qav getXRate <port> <queue> : Get priority queue rate per prot

setXHiLimit.help: qav setXHiLimit <port> <queue> <hiLimit> : Set priority queue HiLimit on a port

getXHiLimit.help: qav getXHiLimit <port> <queue> : Get priority queue HiLimit on a port

write.help: qbv write <port> <regOffset> <data> : Write data to Qbv register

paraList.port: Specified port number, when access Qbv global register port = 0x1F

read.help: qbv read <port> <regOffset> : Read data from Qbv register

paraList.port: Specified port number, when access Qbv global register port = 0x1F

ptp.help: ptp help [subcmd]: Display precise time protocol command options

setPortPTPEn.help: ptp setPortPTPEn <port> <en> : Enables or disables PTP on a port

paraList.en: 1 to enable PTP, 0 to disable PTP

getPortPTPEn.help: ptp getPortPTPEn <port> : Get the PTP enable status on a port

setIntEn.help: ptp setIntEn <port> [options] : Set port arrival/departure interrupt enable/disable

[options](default value for option item: options for Port PTP interrupt Enable/Disable, format as: -ptpArrIntEn 1 -ptpDepIntEn 1

example: To update PTP Interrupt configure, using getIntEn to get origin value and update the field you concern
Note that the not zero origin value should be set back explicitly

getIntEn.help: ptp getIntEn <port> : Get port arrival/departure interrupt enable/disable status

getTimeStamp.help: ptp getTimeStamp <port> <timeToRead> : Get PTP port time stamp value

getTSValid.help: ptp getTSValid <port> <timeToRead> : Get PTP time valid bit

resetTS.help: ptp resetTS <port> <timeToReset> : Reset PTP time valid bit

getIntStatus.help: ptp getIntStatus : Get PTP interrupt status

setMeanPathDelay.help: ptp setMeanPathDelay <port> <delay>: Set ingress mean path delay on a port

paraList.delay: cable delay between this port and its link partner in unsiged nano seconds

getMeanPathDelay.help: ptp getMeanPathDelay <port>: Get ingress mean path delay on a port

setIgrPathDelayAsym.help: ptp setIgrPathDelayAsym <port> <asym>: Set ingress path delay asymmetry on a port

paraList.asym: bit 15 is path delay asymmetry sign(0 added, 1 subtracted), bit 14

getIgrPathDelayAsym.help: ptp getIgrPathDelayAsym <port> : Get ingress path delay asymmetry on a port

setEgrPathDelayAsym.help: ptp setEgrPathDelayAsym <port> <asym>: Set egress path delay asymmetry on a port

paraList.asym: bit 15 is path delay asymmetry sign(0 added, 1 subtracted), bit 14

getEgrPathDelayAsym.help: ptp getEgrPathDelayAsym <port> : Get egress path delay asymmetry on a port

getTODBusyBit.help: ptp getTODBusyBit : Get the busy bit status to see if the Hardware is busy

storeCompensation.help: ptp storeCompensation <Index> [options] : Store Compensation register only to selected TimeArray

[options](default value for option item: options for PTP Time Array parameters
[options](default value for option item.-domainNumber: Domain Number, to be associated with the selected Time Array
[options](default value for option item.-todNanoseconds: Time Array Time of Day, Nano second 32 bits
[options](default value for option item.-todSecondsLow: Time Array Time of Day, second portion 0-31 bits
[options](default value for option item.-todSecondsHigh: Time Array Time of Day, second portion 32-47 bits
[options](default value for option item.-Nanoseconds1722Low: Time Array 1722 Time of Day in Nano seconds 0-31 bits
[options](default value for option item.-Nanoseconds1722High: Time Array 1722 Time of Day in Nano seconds 32-63 bits
[options](default value for option item.-todCompensation: Time Array Time of Day Compensation 32 bits

storeAll.help: ptp storeAll <Index> [options] : Store all register to selected TimeArray

[options](default value for option item: options for PTP Time Array parameters
[options](default value for option item.-domainNumber: Domain Number, to be associated with the selected Time Array
[options](default value for option item.-todNanoseconds: Time Array Time of Day, Nano second 32 bits
[options](default value for option item.-todSecondsLow: Time Array Time of Day, second portion 0-31 bits
[options](default value for option item.-todSecondsHigh: Time Array Time of Day, second portion 32-47 bits
[options](default value for option item.-Nanoseconds1722Low: Time Array 1722 Time of Day in Nano seconds 0-31 bits
[options](default value for option item.-Nanoseconds1722High: Time Array 1722 Time of Day in Nano seconds 32-63 bits
[options](default value for option item.-todCompensation: Time Array Time of Day Compensation 32 bits

setPtpPulse.help: ptp setPtpPulse [options] : Set PTP Pulse parameters

[options](default value for option item: options for PTP Pulse parameters
[options](default value for option item.-ptpPulseWidth: Pulse Width for the 1 Pulse Per Second on the Second signal (0~0xf)

-ptpAltTCAMTimeSel: 0 : Use PTP_TRIG, IRL_CLK & Seconds selection for TCAM Time Sel
1 : Use 1722 16 uSec to 536 uSec selection for TCAM Time Sel

-ptp1ppsWidthRange: Pulse Width Range for the 1 Pulse Per Second on the Second signal
0 : 8 nSec units for a 125MHz PTP clock
1 : 64 nSec units for a 125MHz PTP clock
2 : 512 nSec units for a 125MHz PTP clock
3 : 4096 nSec units for a 125MHz PTP clock
4 : 32.768 uSec units for a 125MHz PTP clock
5 : 262.144 uSec units for a 125MHz PTP clock
6 : 2.097 mSec units for a 125MHz PTP clock
7 : 16.777 mSec units for a 125MHz PTP clock

-ptpTCAMTimeSel: TCAM Time Select, along with the Alt TCAM Time Select, is used to select the TCAM Time Key
Alt TCAM Time Sel = 0     Alt TCAM Time Sel = 1

-ptp1ppsPhase: Phase of the 1 Pulse Per Second on the Second signal
0 : leading edge of the 1 PPS signal is the rising edge if the signal
1 : leading edge of the 1 PPS signal is the falling edge if the signal

[options](default value for option item.-ptp1ppsSelect: selected time array used to generate the 1 PPS signal

getPtpPulse.help: ptp getPtpPulse : Get PTP Pulse parameters

getPTPGlobalTime.help: ptp getPTPGlobalTime : Get the global timer value that is running of the free running clock

getPortReg.help: ptp getPortReg <port> <regOffset>: Read value from a designated PTP port register

setPortReg.help: ptp setPortReg <port> <regOffset> <data>: Write value to a designated PTP port register

paraList.data: data writen to a PTP port register

getGlobalReg.help: ptp getGlobalReg <regOffset>: Read value from a designated PTP global register

setGlobalReg.help: ptp setGlobalReg <regOffset> <data>: Write value to a designated PTP global register

paraList.data: data writen to a PTP global register

set1588v2Config.help: ptp set1588v2Config <port> <index> <ptpMode> <ptpStep>: Config device to support IEEE 1588v2

set8021asConfig.help: ptp set8021asConfig <port> <index> <relayMode> : Config device to support IEEE 802.1AS

set8021asRevConfig.help: ptp set8021asRevConfig <port> <index> <relayMode> : Config device to support IEEE 802.1AS REV

setPreemptTimestampSel.help: ptp setPreemptTimestampSel <port> <tsSelect> : Set Preemption Timestamp Select

getPreemptTimestampSel.help: ptp getPreemptTimestampSel <port> : Get Preemption Timestamp Select

setPreemptCtrl.help: ptp setPreemptCtrl <port> <preemptCtrl> : Set PTP Preemption Control

preemptCtrl: 0 : Only process the express ptp frames
1 : Only process the preemptable ptp frame
2 : Process both express and preemptable ptp frames

getPreemptCtrl.help: ptp getPreemptCtrl <port> : Get PTP Preemption Control

qos.help: qos help [subcmd]: Display quality of service command options

setPrioMap.help: qos setPrioMap <port> <table> <entryPtr> [option] : Set port IEEE Priority Mapping

paraList.entryPtr: Pointer to the desired entry of the IEEE Priority Mapping table selected

[options](default value for option item: IEEE priority map options, union struct for different table
Ingress PCP to IEEE_FPRI & IEEE_QPRI mapping w/DEI = 0:
Egress Green Frame FPRI to PCP mapping (non-AVB):
Egress Yellow Frame FPRI to PCP mapping (non-AVB):
Egress AVB Frame FPRI to PCP mapping:
Ingress PCP to IEEE_FPRI & IEEE_QPRI mapping w/DEI = 1:
Egress Green Frame FPRI to DSCP mapping (non-AVB):
Egress Yellow Frame FPRI to DSCP mapping (non-AVB):
Egress AVB Frame FPRI to DSCP mapping:

getPrioMap.help: qos getPrioMap <port> <table> <entryPtr> : Get port IEEE Priority Mapping

table: 0 : Ingress PCP to IEEE_FPRI & IEEE_QPRI mapping w/DEI = 0
1 : Egress Green Frame FPRI to PCP mapping (non-AVB)
2 : Egress Yellow Frame FPRI to PCP mapping (non-AVB)
3 : Egress AVB Frame FPRI to PCP mapping
4 : Ingress PCP to IEEE_FPRI & IEEE_QPRI mapping w/DEI = 1
5 : Egress Green Frame FPRI to DSCP mapping (non-AVB)
6 : Egress Yellow Frame FPRI to DSCP mapping (non-AVB)
7 : Egress AVB Frame FPRI to DSCP mapping

paraList.entryPtr: Pointer to the desired entry of the IEEE Priority Mapping table selected

setCosQueue.help: qos setCosQueue <port> <cos> <queue> : Update the COS to egress queue mapping

paraList.cos: Trusted or assigned cos for the packet
paraList.queue: Physical queue to be mapped for trusted or assigned cos

getCosQueue.help: qos getCosQueue <port> <cos> : Get the physical queue to be mapped for trusted or assigned cos

paraList.cos: Trusted or assigned cos for the packet

setCosDscp.help: qos setCosDscp <port> <cos> <dscp> : Update the COS to DSCP mapping. This will be used for rewriting DSCP for IPv4/IPv6 packets based on the assigned cos value

paraList.cos: Trusted or assigned cos for the packet

getCosDscp.help: qos getCosDscp <port> <cos> :  Get the DSCP for IPv4/IPv6 packets based on the assigned cos value

paraList.cos: Trusted or assigned cos for the packet

setPriMapRule.help: qos setPriMapRule <port> <mode> : Sets priority mapping rule(TagIfBoth bit)

paraList.mode: 1 for user prio rule, 0 for otherwise

getPriMapRule.help: qos getPriMapRule <port> : Gets priority mapping rule(TagIfBoth bit)

setInitPri.help: qos setInitPri <port> <mode> : Sets initial Priority assignment

getInitPri.help: qos getInitPri <port> : Gets initial Priority assignment

setDefQPri.help: qos setDefQPri <port> <mode> : Set Default queue priority

getDefQPri.help: qos getDefQPri <port> : Get Default queue priority

setDefFPri.help: qos setDefFPri <port> <mode> : Set Default frame priority

getDefFPri.help: qos getDefFPri <port> : Get Default frame priority

enRewriteDscp.help: qos enRewriteDscp <port> <en> : Enable/disable DSCP re-write at egress on the packet

paraList.en: enable/disable DSCP re-write at egress on the packet

tcam.help: tcam help [subcmd]: Display tcam command options

delEntry.help: tcam delEntry <entryNum> : Flush one single entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM

addEntry.help: tcam addEntry <entryNum> [options] : Load one tcam entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM

[options](default value for option item: options for tcam entry, format as: -continu 0 -dpvMode 1
[options](default value for option item.-Octet: Ethernet Frame Content octet, format as -Octet <Octet #> <Octet Data> <Octet Mask>, octets start at 1
[options](default value for option item.-frameOctet: array of Ethernet Frame Content,format as -frameOctet {0x11 0x22}
[options](default value for option item.-frameOctetMask: array of Ethernet Frame Content,format as -frameOctetMask {0xff 0xff}

-continu: 0x0 = Done, don't continue - use ALL the Action bits below for this frame
0x4 = Continue frame matching - use Next Index bits below
0x6 = Done frame matching, continue w/Range Checking immediately
0x7 = Done frame matching, continue w/Range Checking at end of frame

[options](default value for option item.-tcamCtr: Port's TCAM Counter to Increment, format as -IncTcamCtr 1 -tcamCtr 0

modifyEntry.help: tcam modifyEntry <entryNum> [options] : Modify one existed tcam entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM

[options](default value for option item: options for tcam entry, format as: -continu 0 -dpvMode 1
[options](default value for option item.-Octet: Ethernet Frame Content octet, format as -Octet <Octet #> <Octet Data> <Octet Mask>, octets start at 1
[options](default value for option item.-frameOctet: array of Ethernet Frame Content,format as -frameOctet {0x11 0x22}
[options](default value for option item.-frameOctetMask: array of Ethernet Frame Content,format as -frameOctetMask {0xff 0xff}

-continu: 0x0 = Done, don's continue - use ALL the Action bits below for this frame
0x4 = Continue frame matching - use Next Index bits below
0x6 = Done frame matching, continue w/Range Checking immediately
0x7 = Done frame matching, continue w/Range Checking at end of frame

[options](default value for option item.-tcamCtr: Port's TCAM Counter to Increment, format as -IncTcamCtr 1 -tcamCtr 0

copyEntry.help: tcam copyEntry <sourceEntry> <targetEntry> : Copy one existed tcam entry to another entry

paraList.sourceEntry: pointer to the source entry of TCAM
paraList.targetEntry: pointer to the target entry of TCAM

readEntry.help: tcam readEntry <entryNum> : Read one entry data

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM

getNextEntry.help: tcam getNextEntry <entryNum> : Get next valied entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM
the tcam entry index to search

setMode.help: tcam setMode <port> <mode> : Set tcam mode per port

getMode.help: tcam getMode <port> : Get tcam mode per port

addPort.help: tcam addPort <entryNum> <port> : Add a port to an existing tcam entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM

removePort.help: tcam removePort <entryNum> <port> : Remove a port to an existing tcam entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM

egrDelAllPorts.help: tcam egrDelAllPorts <entryNum>: Flush one egress entries for all the ports

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM (1 ~ 63)

egrDelEntry.help: tcam egrDelEntry <port> <entryNum> : Flush one single egress entry per port

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM (1 ~ 63)

egrAddEntry.help: tcam egrAddEntry <port> <entryNum> [options] : Load one egress TCAM entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM (1 ~ 63)

[options](default value for option item: options for tcam entry, format as: -frameModeOverride 0 -frameMode 1
[options](default value for option item.-egSIDOverride: Egress 802.1s Per VLAN Spanning Tree Override Enable

egrReadEntry.help: tcam egrReadEntry <port> <entryNum> : Read one egress entry data

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM (1 ~ 63)

egrGetNextEntry.help: tcam egrGetNextEntry <port> <entryNum> : Get next valied egress entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to start search TCAM

advanceConfig.help: tcam advanceConfig <pktType> <entryNum1> <entrynum2> [options] : Set tcam entry to match standard IPv4/IPv6, TCP/UDP packets with given header and mask

pktType: Enumeration of TCAM mapping packet type

[options](default value for option item: options for tcam key/mask, format as: -frameType 0 -frameTypeMask 0x3
options for standard layer2 header data/mask, format as: -da aabbccddee00 -daMask ffffffffffff
[options](default value for option item.-da: destination mac address, format as aabbccddee00
[options](default value for option item.-sa: source  mac address, format as aabbccddee00
[options](default value for option item.-daMask: Mask for destination mac address, format as aabbccddee00
[options](default value for option item.-saMask: Mask for source  mac address, format as aabbccddee00
[options](default value for option item: options for standard ipv4 header data/mask, format as: -version 4 -versionMask 0xf
[options](default value for option item.-protocolMask: Mask for up level protocol type(8bits)
[options](default value for option item.-sV4IpMask: Mask for source ip address, format as ff.ff.ff.ff
[options](default value for option item.-dV4IpMask: Mask for destination ip address, format as ff.ff.ff.ff
[options](default value for option item: options for standard ipv6 header data/mask, format as: -version 6 -versionMask 0xf
[options](default value for option item.-sV6IpMask: Mask for source ip address, format as ffff:ffff
[options](default value for option item.-dV6IpMask: Mask for destination ip address, format as ffff:ffff
[options](default value for option item: options for standard tcp header data/mask, format as: -srcPort 0x123 -srcPortMask 0xffff
options for standard udp header data/mask, format as: -srcPort 0x123 -srcPortMask 0xffff
options for tcam action, format as: -interrupt 1 -dpvMode 0x3
[options](default value for option item.-tcamCtr: Port's TCAM Counter to Increment, format as -IncTcamCtr 1 -tcamCtr 0

example: To match destionation macAddr and destionation IPV6 ipAddr and replace the frame's DPV

dump.help: tcam dump : Find all the tcam entries and print them out

tcamrc.help: tcamrc help [subcmd]: Display tcam range check command options

delEntry.help: tcamrc delEntry <entryNum> : Flush one single entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM RC

addEntry.help: tcamrc addEntry <entryNum> [options] : Load one TCAM RC entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM RC

[options](default value for option item: options for tcam range check entry, format as: -continu 0 -IncTcamCtr 1
[options](default value for option item.-rcIndex: Link between Frame TCAM hits & the Range Check TCAM, entry's Next Index value is passed to this Range Check TCAM & is used to match this Index field.
[options](default value for option item.-rcResult: Range Check Compare Vector, this field along with the Mask bits, are used to match the results of the desired comparators(on the frame's ingressing port)
[options](default value for option item.-rcResultMask: Mask for Range Check Compare Vector
[options](default value for option item.-tcamCtr: Port's TCAM Counter to Increment, format as -IncTcamCtr 1 -tcamCtr 0

readEntry.help: tcamrc readEntry <entryNum> : Read one entry data

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM RC

getNextEntry.help: tcamrc getNextEntry <entryNum> : Get next valied entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of TCAM RC
the TCAM RC entry index to search.

dump.help: tcamrc dump : Find all the tcam entries and print them out

tcamrccomp.desc: Show tcam range check comparator commands
tcamrccomp.help: tcamrccomp help [subcmd]: Display tcam range check comparator command options

paraList.portNum: pointer to the desired entry of Port Range Comparator

[options](default value for option item: options for port range comparator, format as: -Comp0Sel 1 -Comp0Op 1

-Comp0Op: 0 = Inside - Match if field is inside this comparator's values
1 = Outside - Match if field is outside this comparators's values

[options](default value for option item.-Comp0LoLimit: Compare Low Limit 0, This field is used to define comparator 0's low limit
[options](default value for option item.-Comp0HiLimit: Compare High Limit 0, This field is used to define comparator 0's high limit

readRCComp.help: tcamrccomp readRCComp <portNum> : Read one comparator data

paraList.portNum: pointer to the desired entry of Port Range Comparator

delAll.help: tcamrccomp delAll : Flush all ports comparator data

delEntry.help: tcamrccomp delEntry <portNum> : Flush one port comparator data

paraList.portNum: pointer to the desired entry of Port Range Comparator

arp.help: arp help [subcmd]: Display tcam arp command options

delEntry.help: arp delEntry <entryNum> : Flush one arp entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of ARP

addMcEntry.help: arp addMcEntry <entryNum> [options] : Load one multicast arp entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of ARP

[options](default value for option item: options for multicast ARP data, format as: -dupNum {1 2 3}

addUcEntry.help: arp addUcEntry <entryNum> [options] : Load one unicast arp entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of ARP

[options](default value for option item: options for unitcast ARP data, format as: -routeDA aabbccddee00
[options](default value for option item.-routeDA: ARP DA MAC address for unicast

readEntry.help: arp readEntry <entryNum> : Read one entry data

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of ARP

getNextEntry.help: arp getNextEntry <entryNum> : Get next valid entry

paraList.entryNum: pointer to the desired entry of ARP

rmu.help: rmu help [subcmd]: Display rmu command options

getID.help: rmu getID : Get the current Device ID

dumpAtu.help: rmu dumpAtu <continueCode> : Dump ATU entry from the specified starting address

paraList.continueCode: seaching pointer for ATU dump, using 0 to start at the beginning of the ATU's memory

dumpEcid.help: rmu dumpEcid <continueCode> : Dump ECID entry from the specified starting address(ECID should be enabled)

paraList.continueCode: seaching pointer for Ecid dump, using 0x2000 to start at the beginning of the Ecid's memory

dumpMib2.help: rmu dumpMib2 <enClearOnRead> <port> : Dump MIB2 from the specified port

paraList.enClearOnRead: indicate dump mib clear or not. 1 to clear, 0 to otherwise

dumpTcam.help: rmu dumpTcam <continueCode> : Dump valid TCAM entries

paraList.continueCode:
seaching pointer for TCAM dump, logic like the GetNex operation.
	using 0xff to start at the beginning of the memery

tcamRead.help: rmu tcamRead <entryNum> : Read back single TCAM entry

paraList.entryNum: tcam entry number

tcamWrite.help: rmu tcamWrite <entryNum> [options] : Load single TCAM entry

paraList.entryNum: tcam entry number

[options](default value for option item: options for tcam entry, format as: -continu 0 -dpvMode 1
[options](default value for option item.-Octet: Ethernet Frame Content octet, format as -Octet <Octet #> <Octet Data> <Octet Mask>, octets start at 1
[options](default value for option item.-frameOctet: array of Ethernet Frame Content,format as -frameOctet {0x11 0x22}
[options](default value for option item.-frameOctetMask: array of Ethernet Frame Content,format as -frameOctetMask {0xff 0xff}
[options](default value for option item.-tcamCtr: Port's TCAM Counter to Increment, format as -IncTcamCtr 1 -tcamCtr 0

dumpReg.help: rmu dumpReg <devAddr> : Dump 32 registers for the specified device address

trunk.help: trunk help [subcmd]: Display link aggregation (LAG/port trunking) command options

setTrunkMask.help: trunk setTrunkMask <maskNum> <trunkMask> : Sets Trunk Mask for the given Mask Number

paraList.trunkMask: Trunk mask bits. Bit 0 controls trunk masking for port 0, bit 1 for port 1 , etc

getTrunkMask.help: trunk getTrunkMask <maskNum> : Gets Trunk Mask for the given Trunk Number

setTrunkHash.help: trunk setTrunkHash <en> : Sets Hash DA & SA for TrunkMask selection enable or disable

paraList.en: MSD_TRUE to use lookup table, MSD_FALSE to use XOR

getTrunkHash.help: trunk getTrunkHash  : Gets Trunk Mask for the given Trunk Number enable or disable

setTrunkRoute.help: trunk setTrunkRoute <trunkId> <trunkMap> : This command same as setTrunkMap, in order to version compatibility

paraList.trunkMap: Trunk map bits. Bit 0 controls trunk mapping for port 0, bit 1 for port 1 , etc

getTrunkRoute.help: trunk getTrunkRoute <trunkId> : This command same as getTrunkMap, in order to version compatibility

setTrunkMap.help: trunk setTrunkMap <trunkId> <trunkMap> : Sets mapping information for the given Trunk ID

paraList.trunkMap: Trunk map bits. Bit 0 controls trunk mapping for port 0, bit 1 for port 1 , etc

getTrunkMap.help: trunk getTrunkMap <trunkId> : Gets mapping information for the given Trunk ID

setLAGPort.help: trunk setLAGPort <port> <en> <LAGId> : Enables/disables and sets the LAG ID

paraList.LAGId: 0 ~ 31, valid only if en is MSD_TRUE

getLAGPort.help: trunk getLAGPort <port> : Gets the trunk state of the port

port.help: port help [subcmd]: Display port command options

setForceDefVid.help: port setForceDefVid <port> <en> : Set the port ForceDefaultVID

getForceDefVid.help: port getForceDefVid <port> : Get the port ForceDefaultVID

setDefVid.help: port setDefVid <port> <vid> : Set the port default vlan id

getDefVid.help: port getDefVid <port> : Get the port default vlan id

setQMode.help: port setQMode <port> <mode> : Sets the IEEE 802.1Q mode for this port

getQMode.help: port getQMode <port> : Gets the IEEE 802.1Q mode for this port

setDiscardTagged.help: port setDiscardTagged <port> <en> : Set discard tagged frame,1 to discard tagged frame, 0 otherwise

getDiscardTagged.help: port getDiscardTagged <port> : Get discard tagged frame,1 to discard tagged frame, 0 otherwise

setDiscardUTagged.help: port setDiscardUTagged <port> <en> : Set discard untagged frame,1 to discard untagged frame, 0 otherwise

getDiscardUTagged.help: port getDiscardUTagged <port> : Get discard untagged,1 to discard untagged frame, 0 otherwise

setUCFloodBlock.help: port setUCFloodBlock <port> <en> : Set Egress Flooding mode for unitcaset of a switch port

paraList.en: 1 to do not egress out the unknown DA unicast frames, 0 for normal operation

getUCFloodBlock.help: port getUCFloodBlock <port> : Get Egress Flooding mode for unitcaset of a switch port

setMCFloodBlock.help: port setMCFloodBlock <port> <en> : Set Egress Flooding mode for multicast of a switch port

paraList.en: 1 to do not egress out the unknown DA multicast frames, 0 for normal operation

getMCFloodBlock.help: port getMCFloodBlock <port> : Get Egress Flooding mode for multicast of a switch port

setBCMode.help: port setBCMode <port> <en> : Sets the Discard Broadcast mode

paraList.en: 1 to enable the discard broadcast mode, 0 for normal operation

getBCMode.help: port getBCMode <port> : Gets the Discard Broadcast mode

setIGMPSnoopEnable.help: port setIGMPSnoopEnable <port> <en> : Sets the Enable/disable trapping all IPV4 IGMP packets to the CPU,based on their ingress port

paraList.en: 1 to enable the mode that trapping all the IPV4 IGMP or IPV6 MLD packets to CPU, 0 to disable the mode

getIGMPSnoopEnable.help: port getIGMPSnoopEnable <port>  : Gets the Enable/disable trapping all IPV4 IGMP packets to the CPU,based on their ingress port

setHeaderMode.help: port setHeaderMode <port> <en> : Sets the ingress and egress header mode of a switch port

paraList.en: 1 to enable the ingress and egress header mode, 0 to disable the mode

getHeaderMode.help: port getHeaderMode <port> : Gets the ingress and egress header mode of a switch port

setDropOnLock.help: port setDropOnLock <port> <en> : Sets the DropOnLock mode of specified port on specified device

paraList.en: 1 to enable the drop on lock mode, 0 to disable the mode

getDropOnLock.help: port getDropOnLock <port> : Gets the DropOnLock mode of specified port on specified device

setMtu.help: port setMtu <port> <mode> : Set the max frame size allowed to be received and transmitted from or to a given port

mode: 0: Rx and Tx frames with max byte of 1518 for untagged and 1522 for tagged
1: Rx and Tx frames with max byte of 2044 for untagged and 2048 for tagged
2: Rx and Tx frames with max byte of 10236 for untagged and 10240 for tagged

getMtu.help: port getMtu <port> : Get the max frame size allowed to be received and transmitted from or to a given port

setSpecifiedMtu.help: port setSpecifiedMtu <port> <size> : Set specified MTU allowed to be received and transmitted from or to a given port

paraList.size: specified MTU size, if size equal to 0, MTU value is 2048

getSpecifiedMtu.help: port getSpecifiedMtu <port> : Get specified MTU allowed to be received and transmitted from or to a given port

setLearnEnable.help: port setLearnEnable <port> <en> : Enables/disables automatic learning of new source MAC

getLearnEnable.help: port getLearnEnable <port> : Gets LearnEnable setup status

setVTUPriOverride.help: port setVTUPriOverride <port> <mode> : Set VTU Priority Override of specified port on specified device

getVTUPriOverride.help: port getVTUPriOverride <port> : Get VTU Priority Override of specified port on specified device

setSAPriOverride.help: port setSAPriOverride <port> <mode> : Set SA Priority Override of specified port on specified device

getSAPriOverride.help: port getSAPriOverride <port> : Get SA Priority Override of specified port on specified device

setDAPriOverride.help: port setDAPriOverride <port> <mode> : Set DA Priority Override of specified port on specified device

getDAPriOverride.help: port getDAPriOverride <port> : Get DA Priority Override of specified port on specified device

paraList.en: 1 to enable this port as message port, 0 to disable the mode

getMsgPort.help: port getMsgPort <port> : Get if one specified port is message port

setEtherType.help: port setEtherType <port> <eType> : Sets the port's special Ether Type

getEtherType.help: port getEtherType <port> : Gets the port's special Ether Type

setAllowVidZero.help: port setAllowVidZero <port> <en> : Set allow VID of Zero of specified port on specified device

paraList.en: 1 to allow the vid of zero, 0 to disable the mode

getAllowVidZero.help: port getAllowVidZero <port> :  Get allow VID of Zero of specified port on specified device

mode: Enumeration of the port egress rate limit counting mode

paraList.rate: union data, kbRate or frame Rate based on ELIMIT_MODE

getEgrRate.help: port getEgrRate <port> : Gets the port's egress data limit mode and limit value

setFlowCtrl.help: port setFlowCtrl <port> <isEnable> <mode> : Enable/disable port flow control and set flow control mode

setEMS.help: port setEMS <port> <mode> : 1 to set EgressMonitorSource, 0 otherwise

getEMS.help: port getEMS <port> : Gets EgressMonitorSource bit for the given port

setIMS.help: port setIMS <port> <mode> : 1 to set IngressMonitorSource, 0 otherwise

getIMS.help: port getIMS <port> : Gets IngressMonitorSource bit for the given port

getDuplex.help: port getDuplex <port> : Retrives the port duplex mode

setForceLinkMode.help: port setForceLinkMode <port> <mode> : Set the force link mode per port

getForceLinkMode.help: port getForceLinkMode <port> : Get the force link mode per port

setForceSpeed.help: port setForceSpeed <port> <mode> : Forces switch MAC speed

getSpeed.help: port getSpeed <port> : Retrives the port MAC speed

paraList.memPortsArray: array of vlan ports for this port, {} clear port based vlan table of this port

getPortBasedVlanMap.help: port getPortBasedVlanMap <port> : Get port based vlan table of a specified port

setEgressMode.help: port setEgressMode <port> <mode> : Set the expected Egress tagging frame format

getEgressMode.help: port getEgressMode <port> : Get egress mode of a specified port

setECID.help: port setECID <port> <ecid> : Set a specified port's E-CID

getECID.help: port getECID <port> : Get E-CID of a specified port

setIgnoreETag.help: port setIgnoreETag <port> <en> : Set a specified port's ignore E-Tag

paraList.en: enable or disable port ignore E-Tag

getIgnoreETag.help: port getIgnoreETag <port> : Get ignore E-Tag of a specified port

setPortState.help: port setPortState <port> <mode> : Set the port state

getPortState.help: port getPortState <port> : Get the port state

setIgnoreFcs.help: port setIgnoreFcs <port> <en> : Enable or disable force good FCS

setAllowBadFcs.help: port setAllowBadFcs <port> <en> : Set allow bad fcs to receiving frames or not

getAllowBadFcs.help: port getAllowBadFcs <port> : Get the allow bad fcs status

paraList.limit: the max number of Pause refresh frames for each congestion situation(0 ~ 0xff)

getPauseLimitOut.help: port getPauseLimitOut <port> : Get pause refresh frames transmit limit

paraList.en: 1 to enable map DA, 0 to disable

getMapDA.help: port getMapDA <port> : Get map DA mode

setARPMirror.help: port setARPMirror <port> <en> : Set ARP mirror enable status

getARPMirror.help: port getARPMirror <port> : Get ARP mirror enable status

setLocked.help: port setLocked <port> <en> : Enable or disable port locked mode

getLocked.help: port getLocked <port> : Get port locked mode status

setHoldAt1.help: port setHoldAt1 <port> <en> : Enable or disable port HoldAt1 mode

getHoldAt1.help: port getHoldAt1 <port> : Get port HoldAt1 mode status

setIntOnAgeOut.help: port setIntOnAgeOut <port> <en> : Enable or disable interrupt on age out

getIntOnAgeOut.help: port getIntOnAgeOut <port> : Get interrupt enable status on age out

setRefreshLocked.help: port setRefreshLocked <port> <en> : Enable or disable auto refresh known addresses when port is locked

mib.help: mib help [subcmd]: Display mib command options

counter: the counter which will be read:

paraList.0x0: Port1 is enable RMU(Remote Management Unit) port for switch
paraList.0x1: Port7 is enable RMU port for switch
paraList.0x2: Port8 is enable RMU port for switch
paraList.0x3: Port9 is enable RMU port for switch
